    Benefits&#148;&nbsp;</FONT></B><FONT size="2">means the
    retirement benefits described in Section&nbsp;5 of this Plan.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">2.14&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">&#147;Subsidiary&#148;&nbsp;</FONT></B><FONT size="2">means,
    as applied with respect to any person or legal entity specified,
    (i)&nbsp;a person or legal entity a majority of the voting stock
    of which is owned or controlled, directly or indirectly, by the
    person or legal entity specified or (ii)&nbsp;any other type of
    business organization in which the person or legal entity
    specified owns or controls, directly or indirectly, a majority
    interest.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">2.15&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">&#147;Supplemental Executive Retirement
    Plan&#148; </FONT></B><FONT size="2">or
    <B>&#147;SERP&#148;&nbsp;</B>means the Ford Motor Company
    Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan, as it may be amended.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B><FONT size="2">Section&nbsp;3. Elections</FONT></B>
<P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">3.01&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">Effective Elections.
    </FONT></B><FONT size="2">An Eligible Executive who voluntarily
    elects to retire under the terms of the Plan must submit to the
    Company a completed and signed election form stating that the
    retirement is voluntary and designating a Retirement Effective
    Date. The Company shall provide the election forms and no other
    election forms shall be used.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">3.02&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">Revocations of Elections.
    </FONT></B><FONT size="2">An Eligible Executive may revoke an
    election to retire by giving written notice to the Company prior
    to the Retirement Effective Date. No revocations will be
    effective if received after the Retirement Effective Date.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B><FONT size="2">Section&nbsp;4. Eligibility for Retirement
Plans. </FONT></B><FONT size="2">The eligibility of an Eligible
Executive to receive a benefit under this Plan shall be
determined in accordance with the provisions of the Retirement
Plans after giving effect to the following adjustments:
</FONT>
<P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">Eligibility Service under the SERP shall be
    adjusted by adding three years of Eligibility Service to the
    years of Eligibility Service the Eligible Executive has attained
    as of the Retirement Effective Date; and
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">For purposes of meeting the minimum eligibility
    requirements under Section&nbsp;2 of ESAP, (i)&nbsp;three years
    of Executive Roll service shall be added to the Eligible Retired
    Executive&#146;s Executive Roll Service as of the Retirement
    Effective Date, and (ii)&nbsp;three years of Contributory
    Service shall be added to the Eligible Executive&#146;s years of
    Contributory Service as of the Retirement Effective Date,
    without the requirement of employee contributions.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="left">
<FONT size="2">In the event an Eligible Executive becomes
eligible to receive a benefit under this Plan solely because of
the service adjustments described above, the Select Benefits
shall be calculated as provided in Section&nbsp;5 below and
shall be payable exclusively under this Plan rather than SERP or
ESAP, as applicable.
</FONT>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B><FONT size="2">Section&nbsp;5. Calculation of Select
Benefits.</FONT></B>
<P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">5.01&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">GRP Select Benefits.
    </FONT></B><FONT size="2">The GRP Select Benefit payable to a
    Retired Executive shall be an amount equal to the difference
    between (X)&nbsp;and (Y)&nbsp;where (X)&nbsp;is the GRP benefit
    determined under the terms of the GRP after giving effect to the
    following adjustments:
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">Add three years to the Retired Executive&#146;s
    attained age as of the Retirement Effective Date only for the
    purpose of determining the applicable early retirement reduction
    factors set forth in Appendix&nbsp;G to the GRP and three years
    to the Retired Executive&#146;s years of Contributory Service as
    of the Retirement Effective Date, without the requirement of
    employee contributions; and
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">Final Average Monthly Salary for a Retired
    Executive under the terms of this Plan shall be determined as if
    the Retired Executive had been a Contributing member and
    received Contributory Service for three additional years after
    the Retirement Effective Date at the Retired Executive&#146;s
    Salary in effect as of the date immediately preceding the
    Retirement Effective Date;
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">and (Y)&nbsp;is the GRP benefit determined under
    the terms of the GRP in effect as of the Retirement Effective
    Date, regardless of whether an application for GRP benefits has
    been submitted or GRP benefit payments have begun.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">The GRP Select Benefit determined as of the
    Retirement Effective Date shall be an amount equal to at least a
    fifteen percent (15%) improvement to the GRP benefit determined
    under the terms of the GRP in effect as of the Retirement
    Effective Date. If the Retired Executive&#146;s benefit under
    the GRP is redetermined at Age&nbsp;62 and One Month, the GRP
    Select Benefit shall be redetermined and adjusted such that the
    GRP Select Benefit shall be an amount equal to at least a
    fifteen percent (15%) improvement to the GRP benefit
    redetermined under the terms of the GRP then in effect as of the
    redetermination date.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">5.02&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">SERP Select Benefits.
    </FONT></B><FONT size="2">The SERP Select Benefit applicable to
    a Retired Executive who is otherwise eligible, or who becomes
    eligible, for a SERP benefit under the terms of the SERP in
    effect as of the Retirement Effective Date, as modified by
    Section&nbsp;4 of this Plan, shall be an amount equal to the
    difference between (X) and (Y)&nbsp;where (X)&nbsp;is the SERP
    benefit determined under the terms of the SERP after giving
    effect to the following adjustments:
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">Add three years to the Retired Executive&#146;s
    attained age as of the Retirement Effective Date and three years
    of Credited Service to the Retired Executive&#146;s years of
    Credited Service as of the Retirement Effective Date; and
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">The Final Five Year Average Base Salary for a
    Retired Executive receiving Credited Service immediately
    preceding his or her Retirement Effective Date under the terms
    of this Plan shall be determined as if the Retired Executive had
    continued to receive Credited Service for three additional years
    after the Retirement Effective Date at the Retired
    Executive&#146;s Monthly Base Salary;
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">and (Y)&nbsp;is the SERP benefit determined under
    the terms of the SERP in effect as of the Retirement Effective
    Date.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">The SERP Select Benefit determined as of the
    Retirement Effective Date shall be an amount equal to at least a
    fifteen percent (15%) improvement to the SERP benefit determined
    under the terms of the SERP in effect as of the Retirement
    Effective Date.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">5.03&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">ESAP Select Benefits.
    </FONT></B><FONT size="2">The ESAP Select Benefit applicable to
    a Retired Executive who is otherwise eligible, or who becomes
    eligible, for an ESAP benefit under the terms of the ESAP in
    effect as of the Retirement Effective Date, as modified by
    Section&nbsp;4 of this Plan,
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">shall be an amount equal to the difference
    between (X) and (Y)&nbsp;where (X)&nbsp;is the ESAP benefit
    determined under the terms of the ESAP in effect as of the
    Retirement Effective Date after giving effect to the following
    adjustments:
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="10%"></TD>
    <TD width="90%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">Add three years to the Retired Executive&#146;s
    attained age as of the Retirement Effective Date; and
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">Add three years of service to the Retired
    Executive&#146;s years of service as of the Retirement Effective
    Date;
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">and (Y)&nbsp;is the ESAP benefit calculated under
    the terms of the ESAP in effect as of the Retirement Effective
    Date.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">The ESAP Select Benefit determined as of the
    Retirement Effective Date shall be an amount equal to at least a
    fifteen percent (15%) improvement to the ESAP benefit determined
    under the terms of the ESAP in effect as of the Retirement
    Effective Date.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">5.04&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">DEP Select Benefits.
    </FONT></B><FONT size="2">The DEP Select Benefit applicable to a
    Retired Executive who is otherwise eligible for a DEP benefit
    under the terms of the DEP in effect as of the Retirement
    Effective Date, shall be an amount equal to the difference
    between (X)&nbsp;and (Y)&nbsp;where (X)&nbsp;is the DEP benefit
    determined under the terms of the DEP after adjusting Final
    Average Monthly Salary as if the Retired Executive had been a
    Contributing member and received Contributory Service for three
    additional years after the Retirement Effective Date at the
    Retired Executive&#146;s Salary and (Y)&nbsp;is the DEP benefit
    determined under the terms of the DEP in effect as of the
    Retirement Effective Date.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B><FONT size="2">Section&nbsp;6.&nbsp;Administration of Select
Benefits. </FONT></B><FONT size="2">Except as otherwise
specifically provided in this Plan, the Select Benefits
attributable to the Retirement Plans shall be administered by
the Company in the same manner as if the Select Benefits were
payable directly from such Retirement Plans. This means that the
underlying eligibility rules (except as modified by
Section&nbsp;4 of this Plan), vesting rules, earning out
provisions and survivorship provisions of the Retirement Plans,
if any, shall apply to the Select Benefits as if such provisions
were fully incorporated in this Plan.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B><FONT size="2">Section&nbsp;7.&nbsp;Payments.
</FONT></B><FONT size="2">The Select Benefits determined under
Section&nbsp;5 shall be payable out of the Company&#146;s
general funds monthly, beginning on the Retirement Effective
Date. Payments to a Retired Executive shall cease at the end of
the month in which the Retired Executive dies. Survivor
benefits, if any, payable under this Plan shall be determined in
accordance with the Retirement Plans after giving effect to the
adjustments described herein.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B><FONT size="2">Section&nbsp;8.&nbsp;Reduction of Minimum
Age&nbsp;Eligibility.</FONT></B>
<P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">8.01&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">Authority to Reduce Minimum
    Age&nbsp;Eligibility. </FONT></B><FONT size="2">The Chief
    Executive Officer of the Company shall have the authority, from
    time to time in his or her sole and absolute discretion, to
    reduce the minimum age eligibility specified in
    Section&nbsp;2.06(i) of the Plan from age 55 to age 52.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">8.02&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">Under Age&nbsp;55 Select Benefits.
    </FONT></B><FONT size="2">If an Eligible Executive becomes
    eligible to receive a Select Benefit under this Plan pursuant to
    Section&nbsp;8.01, the Select Benefits shall be calculated as
    provided in Sections&nbsp;5 and 7 above. When a benefit becomes
    payable to the Eligible Executive under the Retirement Plans,
    the amount of the Select Benefits shall be reduced by the
    amounts payable from such other Retirement Plans.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">8.03&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">Subsidiary Retirement Plans.
    </FONT></B><FONT size="2">If an Eligible Executive under age 55
    would have become eligible for a regular early retirement
    benefit from a Subsidiary&#146;s retirement plan if he or she
    had remained in Subsidiary employment until the minimum age or
    service eligibility requirements under such Subsidiary&#146;s
    plan were met, this Plan shall pay the equivalent Subsidiary
    early retirement benefit that otherwise would have been paid if
    the minimum eligibility requirements were met on the Retirement
    Effective Date. The payment shall
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">cease at such time as the regular early
    retirement benefit from the Subsidiary&#146;s plan becomes
    payable. If the Subsidiary&#146;s plan shall pay only a deferred
    vested benefit at age 55, the payment shall cease at death of
    the Eligible Executive. Survivor benefits, if any, shall cease
    at death of the Surviving Spouse. Any payments payable under
    this Plan shall be reduced by the amount of the deferred vested
    or survivor&#146;s benefit payable under such Subsidiary&#146;s
    plan. The amounts payable pursuant to this paragraph shall be in
    addition to any other Select Benefits that otherwise may be
    payable under this Plan.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B><FONT size="2">Section&nbsp;9.&nbsp;General
Provisions.</FONT></B>
<P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">9.01&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">Plan Administration and Interpretation.
    </FONT></B><FONT size="2">The Vice President&nbsp;&#151; Human
    Resources and the Group Vice President and Chief Financial
    Officer shall have full power and authority on behalf of the
    Company to administer and interpret the Plan. In the event of a
    change in a designated officer&#146;s title, the officer or
    officers with functional responsibility for the Retirement Plans
    shall have the power and authority to administer and interpret
    the Plan. All decisions with respect to the administration and
    interpretation of the Plan shall be final and binding upon all
    persons.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">9.02&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">Deductions. </FONT></B><FONT size="2">The
    Company may deduct from any payment of Select Benefits to a
    Retired Executive all amounts owing to it by such Retired
    Executive for any reason, and all taxes required by law or
    government regulation to be deducted or withheld.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">9.03&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">No Contract of Employment.
    </FONT></B><FONT size="2">The Plan is an expression of the
    Company&#146;s present policy with respect to Eligible
    Executives. It is not a part of any contract of employment. No
    Eligible Executive, Retired Executive or any other person shall
    have any legal or other right to any Select Benefit.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">9.04&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">No Company Reemployment.
    </FONT></B><FONT size="2">A Retired Executive shall not be
    eligible for reemployment by the Company either directly or
    indirectly through an agency or otherwise. This includes, but is
    not limited to, employment of a Retired Executive by the Company
    as a supplemental employee, independent contractor, consultant,
    advisor, or agency employee, regardless of the length of
    employment. It also includes employment of a Retired Executive
    by a sole or single source supplier to the Company, or
    employment by any supplier of the Company if the
    responsibilities of the Retired Executive relate primarily to
    the Company&#146;s business with the supplier, and are not
    merely incidental to the performance of the Retired
    Executive&#146;s other job duties. A review panel consisting of
    at least two representatives from Human Resources and one
    representative from the Office of the General Counsel shall be
    established to review Retired Executive&#146;s requests for
    reemployment. The Retired Executive shall furnish to the Review
    Panel such information about the proposed employment as is
    reasonably requested to enable the Review Panel to evaluate the
    request. The Review Panel shall have sole and absolute
    discretion to determine whether the request for reemployment
    violates this provision. Decisions of the Review Panel are final
    and binding on all parties and are not subject to further review.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="7%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">The reemployment condition may be waived by the
    Executive Personnel Committee (EPC)&nbsp;if the proposed
    employment advances the strategic interests of the Company or is
    otherwise determined to be in the best interests of the Company.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">In the event a Retired Executive becomes
    reemployed in violation of this provision without obtaining a
    waiver, the EPC may suspend Select Benefits retroactively to the
    date of reemployment and recover amounts overpaid from the
    Retired Executive&#146;s non-qualified benefits, if any, or any
    other source permitted by law. The EPC also may terminate a
    Retired Executive&#146;s future eligibility for Select Benefits
    or take any other action reasonably necessary, in the EPC&#146;s
    sole discretion, to enforce the provisions of this Section.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="93%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">9.05&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">Select Benefits Not Funded.
    </FONT></B><FONT size="2">The Company&#146;s obligations under
    this Plan are not funded. Select Benefits under this Plan shall
    be payable only out of the general funds of the Company.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">9.06&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">Continuing Plan. </FONT></B><FONT size="2">The
    Plan shall be an ongoing Plan and shall be made available at the
    discretion of the Company. The Company may designate certain
    periods within a calendar year in which offers of Select
    Benefits may be made and may provide that no offers of Select
    Benefits may be accepted before or after designated dates within
    a calendar year. The Company also may limit the offer of Select
    Benefits to those within a designated salary roll or band.
    Select Benefits may be combined with additional types of
    termination incentives upon the direction of the Company.
    Provisions of such other termination incentives are not governed
    by the terms of this Plan.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">9.07&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">Governing Law.
    </FONT></B><FONT size="2">Except as otherwise provided under
    federal law, the Plan and all rights thereunder shall be
    governed, construed and administered in accordance with the laws
    of the State of Michigan.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">9.08&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">Amendment or Termination.
    </FONT></B><FONT size="2">The Company reserves the right to
    modify or amend, in whole or in part, or to terminate this Plan,
    at any time without notice.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">9.09&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">Terms Not Otherwise Defined.
    </FONT></B><FONT size="2">Capitalized terms not otherwise
    defined in this Plan shall have the same meanings ascribed to
    such terms under the applicable Retirement Plans.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B><FONT size="2">9.10&nbsp;</FONT></B></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <B><FONT size="2">Miscellaneous.
    </FONT></B><FONT size="2">Notwithstanding anything contained in
    the Plan to the contrary, no otherwise permissible election is
    allowed that would trigger taxation of any amount under section
    409(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.O
<SEQUENCE>10
<FILENAME>k91869exv10wo.htm
<DESCRIPTION>DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10wo</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<P align="right">
<B><FONT size="2">Exhibit&nbsp;10-O</FONT></B>

<P align="center">
<B><FONT size="2">FORD MOTOR COMPANY DEFERRED COMPENSATION
PLAN</FONT></B>

<DIV align="center">
<FONT size="2">(Amended and Restated as of January&nbsp;1, 2005)
</FONT>
</DIV>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">1.&nbsp;<U>Purpose</U>.&nbsp;This Plan, which
shall be known as the &#147;Ford Motor Company Deferred
Compensation Plan&#148; and is hereinafter referred to as the
&#147;Plan&#148;, is intended to provide for the deferment of
payment of (i)&nbsp;awards of incentive compensation under the
Ford Motor Company Annual Incentive Compensation Plan and
similar plans, (ii)&nbsp;base salary, (iii)&nbsp;incentive
awards payable in cash or stock under the Ford Motor Company
1990 Long-Term Incentive Plan, Ford Motor Company 1998 Long-Term
Incentive Plan or any other incentive compensation plan of the
Company and (iv)&nbsp;new hire payments.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">2.&nbsp;<U>Definitions</U>.&nbsp;As used in the
Plan, the following terms shall have the following meanings,
respectively:
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(a)&nbsp;The term &#147;AIC Plan&#148; shall mean
the Ford Motor Company Annual Incentive Compensation Pan, as
amended.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(b)&nbsp;The term &#147;Committee&#148; shall
mean, unless the context otherwise requires, the following as
they from time to time may be constituted:
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(i)&nbsp;The Compensation Committee with respect
to all matters affecting any Section&nbsp;16 Person.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(ii)&nbsp;The Deferred Compensation Committee
with respect to all matters affecting employees other than
Section&nbsp;16 Persons.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(c)&nbsp;The term &#147;Company&#148; when used
in the Plan with reference to employment shall include
subsidiaries of the Company.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(d)&nbsp;The term &#147;Compensation
Committee&#148; shall mean the Compensation Committee of the
Board of Directors of the Company.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(e)&nbsp;The term &#147;Deferred
Compensation&#148; shall mean compensation deferred pursuant to
paragraph (a), (b), (c)&nbsp;or (d)&nbsp;of Section&nbsp;5
hereto, and any interest equivalents, dividend equivalents or
other earnings or return on such amounts determined in
accordance with the Plan.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(f)&nbsp;The term &#147;Deferred Compensation
Account&#148; with respect to a participant shall mean the book
entry account established by the Company for such participant
with respect to his or her Deferred Compensation.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(g)&nbsp;The term &#147;Deferred Compensation
Committee&#148; shall mean the committee comprised of the Group
Vice President, Corporate Human Resources and Labor Affairs, the
Group Vice President and Chief Financial Officer and the Vice
President and General Counsel or such other persons as may be
designated members of such Committee by the Compensation
Committee.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(h)&nbsp;The term &#147;employee&#148; shall mean
any person who is regularly employed by the Company or a
subsidiary at a salary (as distinguished from a pension,
retirement allowance, severance pay, retainer, commission, fee
under a contract or other arrangement, or hourly, piecework or
other wage) and is enrolled on the active employment rolls of
the Company or a subsidiary, including, but without limitation,
any employee who also is an officer or director of the Company
or a subsidiary.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(i)&nbsp;The term &#147;Ford Stock&#148; shall
mean Ford Common Stock.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(j)&nbsp;The term &#147;Ford Stock Unit&#148;
shall mean a unit having a value based upon Ford Stock.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(k)&nbsp;The term &#147;LTI Plan&#148; shall mean
the Ford Motor Company 1990 Long-Term Incentive Plan, as
amended, the Ford Motor Company 1998 Long-Term Incentive Plan,
as amended, or any
</FONT>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV align="left">
<FONT size="2">other long-term incentive plans subsequently
adopted by the Company that are substantially similar to such
plans.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(l)&nbsp;The term &#147;SC Plan&#148; shall mean
the Ford Motor Company Supplemental Compensation Plan, as
amended.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(m)&nbsp;The term &#147;Section&nbsp;16
Person&#148; shall mean any employee who is subject to the
reporting requirements of Section&nbsp;16(a) or the liability
provisions of Section&nbsp;16(b) of the Securities Exchange Act
of 1934, as amended.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(n)&nbsp;The term &#147;SSIP&#148; shall mean the
Company&#146;s Savings and Stock Investment Plan for Salaried
Employees, as amended.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(o)&nbsp;The term &#147;subsidiary&#148; shall
mean (i)&nbsp;any corporation a majority of the voting stock of
which is owned directly or indirectly by the Company or
(ii)&nbsp;any limited liability company a majority of the
membership interest of which is owned directly or indirectly by
the Company.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(p)&nbsp;The term &#147;VIP Plan&#148; shall mean
Ford Motor Credit Company Variable Incentive Plan, as amended.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">3.&nbsp;<U>Administration.</U>&nbsp;Except as
otherwise herein expressly provided, the Compensation Committee
shall have full power and authority to construe, interpret and
administer the Plan. The Compensation Committee shall make all
decisions relating to matters affecting any Section&nbsp;16
Person, but may otherwise delegate any of its authority under
the Plan. The Compensation Committee and the Deferred
Compensation Committee each may at any time adopt or terminate,
and may from time to time amend, modify or suspend such rules,
regulations, policies and practices as they in their sole
discretion may determine in connection with the administration
of, or the performance of their respective responsibilities
under, the Plan.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">4.&nbsp;<U>Eligibility of Participants; Amounts
Deferrable.</U>
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(a)&nbsp;Participating Subsidiaries and Foreign
Location Participants.&nbsp;The Deferred Compensation Committee
shall determine the extent to which subsidiaries and employees
at foreign locations may participate in the Plan or similar
plans and the type and amount of compensation that may be
deferred under, or the type and amount of account balances that
may be transferred to, the Plan pursuant to this paragraph (a).
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(b)&nbsp;Annual Incentive Compensation Deferrals
Under the AIC Plan and Other Similar Plans.&nbsp;Subject to any
limitations determined under paragraph (a)&nbsp;or paragraph
(g)&nbsp;of this Section&nbsp;4, U.S. employees who receive an
annual incentive compensation award or an installment of such an
award payable in cash under the AIC Plan or the VIP Plan, are
eligible to defer payment under the Plan from 1% to 100%, in 1%
increments, of such amount net of applicable taxes, but not less
than $1,000, provided that such employees are actively employed
by the Company in Leadership Level&nbsp;1-5 or the equivalent at
the time of the election to defer. Notwithstanding the
foregoing, the Compensation Committee may in its sole discretion
allow deferrals under this paragraph (b)&nbsp;by persons that do
not meet the eligibility requirements described above.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(c)&nbsp;Base Salary Deferrals.&nbsp;Subject to
any limitations determined under paragraph&nbsp;(a) or
paragraph&nbsp;(g) of this Section&nbsp;4, U.S. employees who
are eligible to participate in the AIC Plan or the VIP Plan, and
who are actively employed by the Company in Leadership
Level&nbsp;1-5 or the equivalent at the time a salary deferral
election is made are eligible to defer payment of from 1% to 50%
of base salary in 1% increments, provided that the Compensation
Committee has determined that base salary deferrals may be made
for the employment period covered by such deferral.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Compensation Committee may
impose such additional limitations on eligibility as it deems
appropriate in its sole discretion.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(d)&nbsp;Deferrals of Incentive
Compensation.&nbsp;Subject to any limitations determined under
paragraph&nbsp;(a) or paragraph&nbsp;(g) of this Section&nbsp;4,
U.S. employees who are eligible to participate in the AIC Plan
or the VIP Plan, and who are actively employed by the Company at
the time an
</FONT>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV align="left">
<FONT size="2">election is made to defer payment of an award
payable under the LTI Plan or other incentive compensation plan
are eligible to defer payment of from 1% to 100%, in 1%
increments, of such award net of applicable taxes, but not less
than $1,000 or the equivalent value determined at the time of
the deferral, provided that the Compensation Committee has
determined that deferrals may be made for such awards.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Compensation Committee may in
its sole discretion allow deferrals under this
paragraph&nbsp;(d) by persons that do not meet the eligibility
requirements described above.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(e)&nbsp;Deferral of Awards under SC
Plan.&nbsp;Notwithstanding anything in the Plan to the contrary,
deferrals of awards of supplemental compensation made under the
SC Plan for years 1995-1997 shall be governed by the same
provisions of the Plan that apply to awards of incentive
compensation under the AIC Plan. Any references to the AIC Plan
shall be deemed to cover awards under the SC Plan.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(f)&nbsp;Deferral of New Hire
Payments.&nbsp;Notwithstanding anything contained in the Plan to
the contrary, subject to any limitations determined under
paragraph&nbsp;(a) or paragraph&nbsp;(e) of this Section&nbsp;4,
newly hired U.S. employees who are eligible to participate in
the AIC Plan or the VIP Plan, and who received an employment
offer from the Company that included a new hire payment in cash
are eligible to defer payment from 1% to 100%, in 1% increments,
of such new hire payment net of applicable taxes, but not less
than $1,000, provided that such employees are actively employed
by the Company in Leadership Level&nbsp;1-5 or the equivalent at
the time the new hire payment would otherwise be payable in the
absence of such deferral.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(g)&nbsp;Eligibility of Compensation Committee
Members.&nbsp;No person while a member of the Compensation
Committee shall be eligible to participate under the Plan.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(h)&nbsp;Transfer of Deferral Accounts from SC
Plan.&nbsp;Effective as of the close of business on
October&nbsp;16, 1998, all outstanding book entry accounts
maintained under the SC Plan in the form of contingent credits
for cash and/or Ford Common Stock shall be transferred to the
Plan and governed by the provisions of the Plan. Upon such
transfer, contingent credits for cash shall be valued based on
the Fidelity Retirement Money Market Portfolio and contingent
credits for Ford Common Stock shall be valued based on the Ford
Stock Fund until such time, if any, as all or any part of such
amounts are transferred by the applicable participants to other
investment options available under the Plan. Ultimate payout of
a transferred deferral account shall be in cash, except that, to
the extent that the transferred account is valued based on the
Ford Stock Fund, the participant may make an election prior to
the transfer of the account to receive the ultimate payout in
whole shares of Common Stock.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(j)&nbsp;Payout in Ford Stock.&nbsp;Anything in
the Plan to the contrary notwithstanding, the Compensation
Committee may determine that certain awards otherwise payable in
Ford Stock under the LTI Plan that are deferred under the Plan
shall be distributed in whole shares of Ford Stock rather than
in cash if, at the time of the initial deferral of the award,
the participant elected (i)&nbsp;the Ford Stock Fund as the
option for measuring the value of the award and (ii)&nbsp;shares
of Ford Stock rather than cash as the form of payment. In
addition, the Committee may require, as a condition to such
deferral, that (x)&nbsp;the participant make the elections
described in (i)&nbsp;and (ii)&nbsp;above, (y)&nbsp;the value of
such deferral continue to be measured based on the Ford Stock
Fund with no redesignation of such deferral to other measurement
options under the Plan allowed and (z)&nbsp;the ultimate form of
payout may not be changed by the participant to cash.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">5.&nbsp;<U>Deferral Elections.</U>
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(a)&nbsp;Annual Incentive Compensation
Deferrals.&nbsp;For performance years beginning prior to
January&nbsp;1, 2005, a participant&#146;s decision to defer
payment of annual incentive compensation under
paragraph&nbsp;(b) of Section&nbsp;4 under the Plan must be made
prior to October&nbsp;31 of the performance year for which the
compensation is determined. For performance years beginning on
or after January&nbsp;1, 2005, a participant&#146;s decision to
defer payment of annual incentive compensation under
</FONT>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV align="left">
<FONT size="2">paragraph&nbsp;(b) of Section&nbsp;4 under the
Plan must be made prior to June&nbsp;30 of the performance year
for which the compensation is determined.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(b)&nbsp;Base Salary Deferrals.&nbsp;A
participant&#146;s decision to defer payment of base salary
under the Plan must be made prior to the calendar year during
which the base salary will be earned; provided, however, that
such decision may be made with respect to base salary earned
during the first calendar year that base salary deferrals are
permitted under the Plan within thirty days of implementation of
the base salary component of the Plan but prior to earning any
such salary.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(c)&nbsp;Incentive Compensation
Deferrals.&nbsp;Subject to the limitations set forth in
Section&nbsp;4 hereof, the Compensation Committee shall
determine the required timing for participants to make elections
to defer payment of awards payable in cash or stock under the
LTI Plan or other incentive compensation plan.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(d)&nbsp;New Hire Payment Deferrals.&nbsp;A
participant&#146;s decision to defer payment of a new hire
payment must be made no later than the day the payment would
otherwise be made.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(e)&nbsp;Mandatory Deferrals.&nbsp;The
Compensation Committee may mandatorily defer payment under the
Plan of a portion of certain annual incentive compensation
awards pursuant to the AIC Plan. The Compensation Committee may
determine the extent to which it may mandatorily defer payment
under the Plan of awards payable in cash or stock under the LTI
Plan or other incentive compensation plan.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(f)&nbsp;Deferred Compensation
Accounts.&nbsp;Amounts deferred pursuant to paragraphs&nbsp;(a),
(b), (c), (d)&nbsp;or (e)&nbsp;of Section&nbsp;5, and deferral
amounts relating to any transfer to the Plan pursuant to
paragraph&nbsp;(h) of Section&nbsp;4, will be credited by book
entry to the participant&#146;s Deferred Compensation Account.
All such amounts shall be held in the general funds of the
Company. Each participant shall have the status of an unsecured
general creditor of the Company with respect to his or her
Deferred Compensation Account. The participant shall designate
the percentage of the amount elected for deferral to be
allocated to each investment option available under the Plan for
purposes of accounting only and not for actual investment. In
addition, with respect to any particular deferral under the
Plan, the participant shall elect (i)&nbsp;the year in which
distribution shall be made or distribution upon retirement and
(ii)&nbsp;the method of distribution desired with respect to any
such deferral election if the participant elected distribution
upon retirement, i.e., in a lump sum payment or in up to ten
annual installments.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(g)&nbsp;Prohibited Elections or Other
Actions.&nbsp;Notwithstanding anything contained in the Plan to
the contrary, no otherwise permissible election or other action
is allowed that would trigger taxation of any amount under
Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as
amended.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">6.&nbsp;<U>Investment Options; Methodology; No
Ownership Rights.</U>
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(a)&nbsp;General.&nbsp;Unless otherwise delegated
to the Deferred Compensation Committee, the Compensation
Committee has the sole discretion to determine the investment
options available as the measurement mechanism for deferrals and
redesignations under the Plan, the manner and extent to which
elections may be made, the method of valuing the various
investment options and the Deferred Compensation Accounts and
the method of crediting the Deferred Compensation Accounts with,
or making other adjustments as a result of, dividend
equivalents, interest equivalents or other earnings or return on
such Accounts.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(b)&nbsp;Investment Options.&nbsp;Unless
otherwise determined by the Compensation Committee, the
investment options available as the measurement mechanism for
deferrals and redesignations under the Plan shall be some or all
of those provided in the Company&#146;s SSIP.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(c)&nbsp;Methodology.&nbsp;Unless otherwise
determined by the Compensation Committee, the methodology for
valuing the various investment options and the Deferred
Compensation Accounts and for calculating amounts to be credited
or debited or other adjustments to any Deferred
</FONT>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV align="left">
<FONT size="2">Compensation Account with respect to any
investment options shall be the same as that used under the SSIP.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(d)&nbsp;No Ownership Rights.&nbsp;Investment
options available under the Plan shall be used solely for
measuring the value of Deferred Compensation Accounts and
accounting, on a book entry basis, as if the deferred amounts
had been invested in actual investments, but no such investments
shall be made on behalf of participants. Participants shall not
have any voting rights or any other ownership rights with
respect to the investment options selected as the measuring
mechanism for their Deferred Compensation Accounts.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">7.&nbsp;<U>Redesignation Within a Deferred
Compensation Account.</U>
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(a)&nbsp;General.&nbsp;Except as otherwise
provided in paragraph&nbsp;(f) of this Section&nbsp;7, a
participant or the beneficiary or legal representative of a
deceased participant, may redesignate amounts credited to a
Deferred Compensation Account among the investments available
under the Plan. No redesignations relating to a particular
deferral may occur on or after the scheduled distribution date
for the deferral under the Plan.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(b)&nbsp;Eligible Participants.&nbsp;Active
employees and retired participants are eligible to redesignate.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(c)&nbsp;Permitted Frequency.&nbsp;Redesignations
may be made at the same frequency as transfers may be made under
the SSIP.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(d)&nbsp;Amount of Redesignation.&nbsp;Any
redesignation relating to a particular deferral shall be in a
specified percentage or dollar amount of the investment option
from which the redesignation is being made.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(e)&nbsp;Timing.&nbsp;Redesignation shall occur
on the day the participant&#146;s written redesignation election
form or telephonic election is received by the Company or its
agent designated for this purpose; provided, however, that if
such redesignation request is received after 4&nbsp;p.m. Eastern
Time, or on a day that is not a business day (i.e., a day that
either the Company&#146;s World Headquarters offices in
Dearborn, Michigan or the principal offices of its designated
agent are not open to the public for business), then such
redesignation shall be effective on the next business day.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(f)&nbsp;Limitations on Redesignations Involving
Ford Stock Units.&nbsp;The Committee in its sole discretion at
any time may rescind a redesignation in or out of Ford Stock
Units if such redesignation was made by a participant who
(i)&nbsp;at the time of the redesignation the Committee believes
was in the possession of material, nonpublic information with
respect to the Company and (ii)&nbsp;in the Committee&#146;s
estimation benefited from such information by the timing of his
or her redesignation. In the event of a rescission, the
participant&#146;s Deferred Compensation Account shall be
restored to a status as though such redesignation had not
occurred.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">8.&nbsp;<U>Adjustments.</U>&nbsp;In the event of
a reorganization, recapitalization, stock split, stock dividend,
combination of shares, merger, consolidation, rights offering or
any other change in the corporate structure of the Company or
shares of Ford Stock or units of any other investment option
provided under the Plan, the Compensation Committee shall make
such adjustments, if any, as it may deem appropriate in the
number of Ford Stock Units, shares of Ford Stock, including
shares represented by Ford Stock Units, or shares or units of
other investment options credited to participants&#146; Deferred
Compensation Accounts.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">9.&nbsp;<U>Distribution of Deferred Compensation;
Financial Hardship.</U>
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(a)&nbsp;General.&nbsp;Except as otherwise
provided in paragraph&nbsp;(b) of this Section&nbsp;9 or in
Section&nbsp;11, or as otherwise determined by the Committee,
distribution of all or any part of a participant&#146;s Deferred
Compensation Account shall be made on, or as soon thereafter as
practicable, (i)&nbsp;March&nbsp;15 of the year selected by the
participant for distribution with respect to the particular
deferral if the participant is an active employee of the Company
on the distribution date, (ii)&nbsp;the
</FONT>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV align="left">
<FONT size="2">March&nbsp;15 following death or termination for
reasons other than retirement, notwithstanding any prior
selection by the participant of a subsequent year for
distribution with respect to the particular deferral,
(iii)&nbsp;the March&nbsp;15 following retirement if the
participant selected distribution upon retirement with respect
to the particular deferral and a lump sum distribution was
selected, or if the participant selected a particular year for
distribution with respect to the particular deferral but retired
prior to the year selected, or (iv)&nbsp;the March&nbsp;15
following retirement with respect to the first annual
installment and continuing on the applicable number of
consecutive anniversaries of such date if no more than ten
annual installments were selected by the participant with
respect to the particular deferral. Unless otherwise determined
by the Committee, a Deferred Compensation Account or part
thereof relating to a particular distribution shall be valued,
for purposes of the distribution, as of the following applicable
date or as soon thereafter as practicable: March&nbsp;15 of the
year of distribution or the next preceding day for which
valuation information is available.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(b)&nbsp;Financial Hardship.&nbsp;At the written
request of a participant, the Committee, in its sole discretion,
may authorize the cessation of deferrals under the Plan by such
participant and distribution of all or any part of the
participant&#146;s Deferred Compensation Account prior to his or
her scheduled distribution date or dates, or accelerate payment
of any installment payable with respect to Deferred
Compensation, upon a showing of unforeseeable emergency by the
participant. For purposes of this paragraph, &#147;unforeseeable
emergency&#148; shall mean severe financial hardship resulting
from extraordinary and unforeseeable circumstances arising as a
result of one or more recent events beyond the control of the
participant. In any event, payment shall not be made to the
extent such emergency is or may be relieved (i)&nbsp;through
reimbursement or compensation by insurance or otherwise,
(ii)&nbsp;by liquidation of the participant&#146;s assets, to
the extent the liquidation of such assets would not itself cause
severe financial hardship and (iii)&nbsp;by cessation of
deferrals under the Plan. Withdrawals of amounts because of
unforeseeable emergency shall only be permitted to the extent
reasonably necessary to satisfy the emergency. Examples of what
are not considered to be unforeseeable emergencies include the
need to send a participant&#146;s child to college or the desire
to purchase a home. The Committee shall determine the applicable
distribution date and the date as of which the amount to be
distributed shall be valued with respect to any financial
hardship withdrawal or distribution made pursuant to this
paragraph&nbsp;(b) of this Section&nbsp;9. Any participant whose
deferrals have ceased under the Plan pursuant to this paragraph
may not elect to recommence deferrals until the next applicable
deferral period.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(c)&nbsp;Prohibited Distributions or Other
Actions.&nbsp;Notwithstanding anything contained in the Plan to
the contrary, no otherwise permissible distribution or other
action is allowed that would trigger taxation of any amount
under Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as
amended.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">10.&nbsp;<U>Designation of Beneficiaries and
Effect of Death</U>.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(a)&nbsp;Designation of Beneficiaries.&nbsp;A
participant may file with the Company a written designation of a
beneficiary or beneficiaries (subject to such limitations as to
the classes and number of beneficiaries and contingent
beneficiaries and such other limitations as the Compensation
Committee from time to time may prescribe) to receive, in the
event of the death of the participant, undistributed amounts of
Deferred Compensation that would have been payable to such
participant had he or she been living. A participant shall be
deemed to have designated as beneficiary or beneficiaries under
the Plan the person or persons who receive such
participant&#146;s life insurance proceeds under the
Company-paid basic Life Insurance Plan unless such participant
shall have assigned such life insurance or shall have filed with
the Company a written designation of a different beneficiary or
beneficiaries under the Plan. A participant may from time to
time revoke or change any such designation of beneficiary and
any designation of beneficiary under the Plan shall be
controlling over any testamentary or other disposition;
provided, however, that if the Committee shall be in doubt as to
the right of any such beneficiary to receive any such payment,
or if applicable law requires the Company to do so, the same may
be paid to the legal representatives of the participant, in
which case the Company, the Committee and the members thereof
shall not be under any further liability to anyone.
</FONT>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(b)&nbsp;Distribution Upon Death.&nbsp;Subject to
the provisions of Section&nbsp;9 hereof, in the event of the
death of any participant prior to distribution of all or part of
such participant&#146;s Deferred Compensation Account, the total
value of such participant&#146;s entire Deferred Compensation
Account shall be distributed in cash, except as otherwise
provided in paragraph&nbsp;(h)&nbsp;or (j)&nbsp;of
Section&nbsp;4, in one lump sum in accordance with
paragraph&nbsp;(a) of Section&nbsp;9 to any beneficiary or
beneficiaries designated or deemed designated by the participant
pursuant to paragraph&nbsp;(a) of this Section&nbsp;10 who shall
survive such participant (to the extent such designation is
effective and enforceable at the time of such participant&#146;s
death) or, in the absence of such designation or such surviving
beneficiary, or if applicable law requires the Company to do so,
to the legal representative of such person, at such time (or as
soon thereafter as practicable) and otherwise as if such person
were living and had fulfilled all applicable conditions as to
earning out set forth in, or established pursuant to the Plan,
provided such conditions shall have been fulfilled by such
person until the time of his or her death.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">11.&nbsp;<U>Effect of Inimical
Conduct</U>.&nbsp;Anything contained in the Plan
notwithstanding, all rights of a participant under the Plan to
receive distribution of all or any part of his or her Deferred
Compensation Account shall cease on and as of the date on which
it has been determined by the Committee that such participant at
any time (whether before or subsequent to termination of such
participant&#146;s employment) acted in a manner inimical to the
best interests of the Company.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">12.&nbsp;<U>Limitations</U>.&nbsp;A participant
shall not have any interest in any Deferred Compensation
credited to his or her Deferred Compensation Account until it is
distributed in accordance with the Plan. All amounts deferred
under the Plan shall remain the sole property of the Company,
subject to the claims of its general creditors and available for
use for whatever purposes are desired. With respect to Deferred
Compensation, a participant shall be merely a general creditor
of the Company and the obligation of the Company hereunder shall
be purely contractual and shall not be funded or secured in any
way. The Plan shall not constitute part of any
participant&#146;s or employee&#146;s employment contract with
the Company or any participating subsidiary. Participation in
the Plan shall not create or imply a right to continued
employment.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">13.&nbsp;<U>Annual Statements of
Account</U>.&nbsp;Account statements shall be sent to
participants as soon as practicable following the end of each
year as to the balances of their respective Deferred
Compensation Accounts as of the end of the previous calendar
year.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">14.&nbsp;<U>Withholding of Taxes</U>.&nbsp;The
Company shall have the right to withhold an amount sufficient to
satisfy any federal, state or local income taxes or FICA or
medicare taxes that the Company may be required by law to pay
with respect to any Deferred Compensation Account, including
withholding payment from a participant&#146;s current
compensation.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">15.&nbsp;<U>No Assignment of
Benefits</U>.&nbsp;No rights or benefits under the Plan shall,
except as otherwise specifically provided by law, be subject to
assignment (except for the designation of beneficiaries pursuant
to paragraph&nbsp;(a) of Section&nbsp;10), nor shall such rights
or benefits be subject to attachment or legal process for or
against a participant or his or her beneficiary or
beneficiaries, as the case may be.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">16.&nbsp;<U>Administration Expense</U>.&nbsp;The
entire expense of offering and administering the Plan shall be
borne by the Company and its participating subsidiaries.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">17.&nbsp;<U>Amendment, Modification, Suspension
and Termination of the Plan; Rescissions and
Corrections</U>.&nbsp;The Compensation Committee, at any time
may terminate, and at any time and from time to time, and in any
respect, may amend or modify the Plan or suspend any of its
provisions; provided, however, that no such amendment,
modification, suspension or termination shall, without the
consent of a participant, adversely affect such
participant&#146;s rights with respect to amounts credited to or
accrued in his or her Deferred Compensation Account. The
Committee at any time may rescind or correct any deferrals or
credits to any Deferred Compensation Account made in error or
that jeopardize the intended tax status or legal compliance of
the Plan.
</FONT>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">18.&nbsp;<U>Indemnification and Exculpation.</U>
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(a)&nbsp;Indemnification.&nbsp;Each person who is
or shall have been a member of the Compensation Committee or a
member of the Deferred Compensation Committee shall be
indemnified and held harmless by the Company against and from
any and all loss, cost, liability or expense that may be imposed
upon or reasonably incurred by such person in connection with or
resulting from any claim, action, suit or proceeding to which
such person may be or become a party or in which such person may
be or become involved by reason of any action taken or failure
to act under the Plan and against and from any and all amounts
paid by such person in settlement thereof (with the
Company&#146;s written approval) or paid by such person in
satisfaction of a judgment in any such action, suit or
proceeding, except a judgment in favor of the Company based upon
a finding of such person&#146;s lack of good faith; subject,
however, to the condition that upon the institution of any
claim, action, suit or proceeding against such person, such
person shall in writing give the Company an opportunity, at its
own expense, to handle and defend the same before such person
undertakes to handle and defend it on such person&#146;s behalf.
The foregoing right of indemnification shall not be exclusive of
any other right to which such person may be entitled as a matter
of law or otherwise, or any power that the Company may have to
indemnify or hold such person harmless.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">(b)&nbsp;Exculpation.&nbsp;Each member of the
Compensation Committee and each member of the Deferred
Compensation Committee shall be fully justified in relying or
acting in good faith upon any information furnished in
connection with the administration of the Plan or any
appropriate person or persons other than such person. In no
event shall any person who is or shall have been a member of the
Compensation Committee or a member of the Deferred Compensation
Committee be held liable for any determination made or other
action taken or any omission to act in reliance upon any such
information, or for any action (including the furnishing of
information) taken or any failure to act, if in good faith.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">19.&nbsp;<U>Finality of
Determinations</U>.&nbsp;Each determination, interpretation or
other action made or taken pursuant to the provisions of the
Plan by the Compensation Committee or the Deferred Compensation
Committee shall be final and shall be binding and conclusive for
all purposes and upon all persons, including, but without
limitation thereto, the Company, its stockholders, the
Compensation Committee and each of the members thereof, the
Deferred Compensation Committee and each of the members thereof,
and the directors, officers, and employees of the Company, the
Plan participants, and their respective successors in interest.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">20.&nbsp;<U>Governing Law</U>.&nbsp;The Plan
shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws
of the State of Michigan.
</FONT>

</BODY>
</HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

<TEXT>

<P align="right">
<B><FONT size="2">Exhibit&nbsp;10-P-1</FONT></B>

<P align="center">
<B><FONT size="2">Annual Incentive Compensation Plan Metrics for
2005</FONT></B>

<P align="left">
<FONT size="2">On March&nbsp;9, 2005, the Compensation Committee
of the Board of Directors of the Company approved the specific
performance goals and business criteria to be used for purposes
of determining any future cash awards for 2005 for participants,
including executive officers, under the Company&#146;s
shareholder-approved Annual Incentive Compensation Plan (filed
as Exhibit&nbsp;10-T to the Company&#146;s Annual Report on
Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 1999). For
most participants, the performance criteria to be used for 2005
under the plan include attaining specified levels of:
</FONT>
<P>

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><FONT size="2">&#149;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">total company pre-tax profits,
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><FONT size="2">&#149;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">relevant business unit pre-tax profits (including
    the related financing profits),
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><FONT size="2">&#149;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">relevant business unit cost reductions,
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><FONT size="2">&#149;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">relevant business unit market shares, and
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><FONT size="2">&#149;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">relevant business unit quality metrics.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="left">
<FONT size="2">Performance results against target levels
established for each of these criteria will be weighted 75% to
total company and business unit pre-tax profits and 25% to
business unit cost performance, market share and quality.
</FONT>

<P align="left">
<FONT size="2">For some participants, including certain
executive officers, whose job responsibilities encompass
multiple business units, the performance criteria to be used for
2005 under the plan include attaining specified levels of:
</FONT>
<P>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><FONT size="2">&#149;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">total company pre-tax profits,
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><FONT size="2">&#149;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">total company cost reductions,
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><FONT size="2">&#149;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">total company market share, and
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><FONT size="2">&#149;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <FONT size="2">total company quality metrics.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="left">
<FONT size="2">Performance results against target levels
established for each of these criteria will be weighted 75% to
total company pre-tax profits and 25% to total company cost
performance, market share and quality.
</FONT>

<P align="left">
<FONT size="2">Based on business performance results for 2005
against the targeted levels established for each criteria, the
Compensation Committee will determine the percentage of the
target award that is earned, which could range between 0% and
200% depending on actual performance achieved relative to the
target levels. In addition, individual awards may be increased
(within limits set by the Compensation Committee) or decreased
from a formula amount, based on leadership level or salary grade
level, to reward a person&#146;s performance.
</FONT>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.Q.1
<SEQUENCE>12
<FILENAME>k91869exv10wqw1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>STOCK OPTION AGREEMENT (NQO)
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10wqw1</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<P align="right">
<B><FONT size="2">Exhibit&nbsp;10-Q-1</FONT></B>

<P align="center">
<B><FONT size="2">STOCK OPTION AGREEMENT UNDER</FONT></B>

<DIV align="center">
<B><FONT size="2">1998 LONG-TERM INCENTIVE PLAN</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<B><FONT size="2">(Nonqualified Option)</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">This AGREEMENT made this
<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>
day of
<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>,
by and between Ford Motor Company, a Delaware corporation (the
&#147;Company&#148;), and &#171;First<U>&nbsp;</U>MI&#187;
&#171;Last<U>&nbsp;</U>name&#187; (the &#147;Optionee&#148;),
WITNESSETH:
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">WHEREAS, the Optionee is now employed by the
Company, or one of its subsidiaries, in a responsible capacity
and the Company desires to provide an incentive to the Optionee,
to encourage the Optionee to remain in the employ of the Company
or of one or more of its subsidiaries and to increase the
Optionee&#146;s interest in the Company&#146;s long-term
success; and as an inducement thereto, the Company has adopted
the 1998 Long-Term Incentive Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;), to be
administered by the Compensation and Option Committee (the
&#147;Committee&#148;), and has determined to grant to the
Optionee the option herein provided for,
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">NOW, THEREFORE, IT IS AGREED BETWEEN THE PARTIES
as follows:
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">Subject to the terms and conditions set forth
herein, in the Plan, in the &#147;Terms and Condition of Stock
Option Agreement&#148; (the &#147;Terms and Conditions&#148;)
and in any rules and regulations established by the Committee
pursuant to the Plan (all of which are incorporated by reference
into this Agreement as though set forth in full herein), the
Company hereby grants to the Optionee the right and option to
purchase from the Company up to, but not exceeding in the
aggregate, &#171;Shares&#187; shares of the Company&#146;s
Common Stock of the par value of $0.01&nbsp;per share
(&#147;Stock&#148;), at a price of
$&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;per
share (the &#147;Option&#148;). The Option shall not be
accompanied by a &#147;Stock Appreciation Right&#148; (as
referred to in the Terms and Conditions).
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">The Optionee agrees to remain in the employ of
the Company or of one or more of its subsidiaries for a period
ending on the later of (a)&nbsp;the date one&nbsp;year from the
date of this Agreement or (b)&nbsp;one year from the latest date
to which the Optionee is obligated to remain in such employ
under any option granted to the Optionee under the Plan or any
Stock Option Plan of the Company or under any amendment to any
such option; provided, however, that, if the second or third
paragraph of Article&nbsp;3 of the Terms and Conditions shall
apply to the Optionee, such period shall be limited to six
months from the date of this Agreement; and provided, further,
that nothing contained herein or in the Terms and Conditions
shall restrict the right of the Company or any of its
subsidiaries to terminate the employment of the Optionee at any
time, with or without cause. The term &#147;Company&#148; as
used in this Agreement and in the Terms and Conditions with
reference to employment shall include subsidiaries of the
Company. The term &#147;subsidiary&#148; as used in this
paragraph shall mean (i)&nbsp;any corporation a majority of the
voting stock of which is owned directly or indirectly by the
Company or (ii)&nbsp;any limited liability company a majority or
the membership interest of which is owned directly or indirectly
by the Company.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">The Option is intended to be a nonqualified
option.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">The grant of the Option to the Optionee is
completely discretionary and does not create any rights to
receive future stock option grants. The Company may amend,
modify or terminate the Plan at any time, subject to limitations
set forth in the Plan.
</FONT>

<P align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<FONT size="2">IN WITNESS THEREOF, the parties hereto have
executed this Agreement as of the day and year first above
written.
</FONT>

<CENTER>
